means: 进攻（性）的，攻击的，攻势的

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"进攻，侵略"之意。
means: aggression ：词义宽泛，既可指武装入侵别国领土，又可指文化、经济等方面的侵略。侧重敌意行动和征服的企图。
invasion ：多指具体的侵入或侵犯别国领土，也可用于指抽象事件。
assault ：主要指突然而猛烈的进攻。
attack ：普通用词，含义广，指事先不发警告，主动地向对方发起武力进攻或对言论等进行抨击。
offensive ：多指进攻的态势，常指大规模的协同军事行动。

sentence.Network_en: The army now appears to have launched a counter-offensive.
sentence.Network_cn: 军队现在似乎已经发起了反攻。

sentence.Network_en: They wanted me to change the title to something less gratuitously offensive.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们希望我将题目修改一下，以免显得太过冒犯。

sentence.Network_en: He would soon launch a second offensive, killing off the peace process.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不久将会再次发动进攻，彻底毁掉整个和平进程。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 六级核心高频词汇表878个 - 豆丁网 ... offence n. 犯罪,犯规;冒犯 398, offensive a. 冒犯的;进攻的 399, offset n. 分支,抵销.
张红岩TOEFL ... odor=odour n. 臭气，名声 offensive adj. 无理的， 攻击性的 offer n.v. 提议，提出.
一些翻译~（转的~） ... nuclear weapon 核武器 offensive 进攻的 on and off 打打停停.
obscurity 冷门offensive 进攻性order of receiving 接发球次序

list.abs: 湖人队的三角战术(triangle offense)、国王队的普林斯顿进攻(princeton offense)都是由挡拆战术(motion offense)衍生而来，这是众所周.
有关法律方面的英文词汇 - 豆丁网 ... driving while intoxicated 酒醉后驾驶 first offense 初犯 economic crimes 经济犯罪.
以上这些就是动态进攻(motion offense)的基本训练方式。每位教练都应该发挥创意，设计出一些帮助你的球员学习MO的训练。
篮球术语_百度百科 ... Defensive Rebound 防守篮板 Offensive Rebound 进攻篮板（offensive rebound） Turnover 失误.

jx.jx_en_mean: act or be ready to act aggressively
jx.jx_cn_mean: 处于攻势，（准备）展开攻势

phrase.cizu_name: go on (to 或 take) the offensive

jx.jx_en_mean: take the initiative by beginning to attack or act aggressively

lj.lj_ly: security forces took the offensive ten days ago.
lj.lj_ls: 安全部队十天前发起了进攻。

means.word_mean: 无礼的,侮辱的,激怒的,令人无法忍受的
进攻性的,敌对的,好战的

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French offensif, -ive or medieval Latin offensivus, from Latin offens- 'struck against', from the verb offendere (see offend)

entry.tran: 冒犯的；得罪人的；唐突的;无礼的
entry.def: Something that is offensive upsets or embarrasses people because it is rude or insulting.

example.ex: Some friends of his found the play horribly offensive.
example.tran: 他的一些朋友觉得该剧非常让人反感。

example.ex: ...offensive remarks which called into question the integrity of my firm.
example.tran: 令我公司的诚信遭受质疑的冒犯性言论

entry.def: A military offensive is a carefully planned attack made by a large group of soldiers.

example.ex: Its latest military offensive against rebel forces is aimed at reopening important trade routes...
example.tran: 它对叛军的最新一轮军事进攻旨在重新打开重要的贸易通道。

example.ex: The armed forces have launched offensives to recapture lost ground.
example.tran: 这支武装部队已发动进攻要夺回失去的阵地。

entry.tran: （表示愤怒或反对的）强硬行动
entry.def: If you conduct an offensive, you take strong action to show how angry you are about something or how much you disapprove of something.

example.ex: Republicans acknowledged that they had little choice but to mount an all-out offensive on the Democratic nominee.
example.tran: 共和党人承认他们别无选择，只有对获提名的民主党人展开全面攻击。

entry.tran: （体育运动中球队）进攻的，攻方的
entry.def: In sports such as American football or basketball, the offensive team is the team which has possession of the ball and is trying to score.

example.ex: The worst-ever defeat of this team proved once again that Stanford can be one of the most explosive offensive teams in the country.
example.tran: 该队前所未有的惨败再次证明斯坦福队是国内最具爆发力的进攻型队伍之一。

entry.tran: 采取强势行动；采取攻势
entry.def: If you go on the offensive ,go over to the offensive, or take the offensive, you begin to take strong action against people who have been attacking you.

example.ex: The West African forces went on the offensive in response to attacks on them...
example.tran: 西非部队对袭击者展开全力还击。

example.ex: The Foreign Secretary has decided to take the offensive in the discussion on the future of the community.
example.tran: 外交大臣决定在有关该社群未来的讨论中采取攻势。

means.word_mean: 1. the action of attacking an enemy
1. violating or tending to violate or offend against;

sentences.sentence: "considered such depravity offensive against all laws of humanity"

means.word_mean: 2. for the purpose of attack rather than defense;
5. unpleasant or disgusting especially to the senses;
6. of an offensive substitute for inoffensive terminology;
7. causing or able to cause nausea;
